1 from typing import Callable
2 
3 import cv2
4 import numpy as np
5 
6 import rospy
7 from sensor_msgs.msg import CompressedImage
8 from .abstract_stream import AbstractStream
9 
10 
11 class Stream(AbstractStream):
12 
13  def __init__(self, topic: str, publish_frame_cb: Callable[[np.ndarray], None]):
14  super().__init__(publish_frame_cb)
15  self.__subscriber = None
16  self.__topic = topic
17  self._frame = np.zeros((480, 640, 3), dtype=np.uint8) # Default size, will be updated in the callback
18 
19  def start(self):
20  if self.__subscriber is not None:
21  self.__subscriber.unregister()
22  self.__subscriber = rospy.Subscriber(self.__topic, CompressedImage, self.__image_callback, queue_size=1)
23 
24  def stop(self):
25  if self.__subscriber is None:
26  return
27  self.__subscriber.unregister()
28  self.__subscriber = None
29 
30  def __image_callback(self, msg: CompressedImage):
31  self._frame = cv2.imdecode(np.frombuffer(msg.data, dtype=np.uint8), cv2.IMREAD_COLOR)
32  self._post_process()
33  self._publish_frame(self._frame)
34 
35  @property
36  def is_active(self) -> bool:
37  """
38  We assume that if there is a publisher on the topic, then the stream is active.
39  :return: True if the stream is active, False otherwise
40  """
41  return self.is_available
42 
43  @property
44  def is_available(self) -> bool:
45  return self.__subscriber is not None and self.__subscriber.get_num_connections() > 0
